channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Hales Road double roundabout sign, 22nd January
item.description:
Hales Road double roundabout sign, northbound, although recently repaired / replaced, the bottom half of the sign has been knocked or blown around, and is facing the opposite direction (!). Could this be rotated and fastened, please ? Thanks !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 156, Hales Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 street lights not working, 22nd January
item.description:
Street light numbers 62 and 64 on Coronation Sq not working
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-3, Princess Elizabeth Way, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 8 Streetlights STILL OUT on Bibury Road/Notgrove Close, 22nd January
item.description:
As per the title, 8 streetlights are still out in Bibury Road/Notgrove Close (since 15th December) It is dangerous at night, trip hazard on uneven paving slabs/kerbs..... a local resident has also been burgled in the darkness....the police are aware and have commented that the lack of street lighting will have contributed to the break in. Still no update or any communication as to when this issue will be solved. Understand it has been "passed onto" National Grid, but some (or any!) update should surely be forthcoming?? This has now been over 5 weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Notgrove Close, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road in very poor quality, 22nd January
item.description:
Large potholes across the middle of the road, road was just closed for 2 weeks but the new surface stops just short of these massive potholes. Too obvious to be missed!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Springbank, Cheltenham

item.title: No cats eyes or road markings visible at night, 22nd January
item.description:
Between junction Shaw Green Lane and Southam village road markings are v faded. No cats eyes work. Glare from oncoming headlights while heading along road make it difficult. Often cyclists and pedestrians alongside this v busy road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Southam, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 22nd January
item.description:
Customer states that when the Ped crossing on Glouecster road is pressed the traffic builds up and traffic gets stuck on the junction with Tewksbury Road. Advised that the ped crossing is independent from the lights at the junction but sig faults may be able to look at the timings coming off the junction and ease the traffic getting stuck on the junction.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 22nd January
item.description:
Large tree outside properties. Large branches came down into the road, very concerned about safety of this tree, as another tree came down. Requesting that the crown is reduced in size, like the other trees in the area
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding occurs on roundabout where drain is, 22nd January
item.description:
The drain on roundabout is either blocked or cannot cope with heavy rain on side nearest GE which cause flooding across majority of the road in that area. (Cannot take a photo as too dangerous when driving and no where to stop)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 22nd January
item.description:
email rec 19/01/2024 - Another thing I would like to mention is that signs about diversions are left up long after the diversion is no longer necessary. This causes confusion for motorist. Also signs warning of flood or other hazards are also left in place after the hazard has passed. There is a flood warning sign near the Double Tree Hotel which has been there for some considerable time. Is there some department that is tasked to collect such signs? If they were collected in timely fashion it would save the Highways authority money in not having to have more signs manufactured.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 22nd January
item.description:
email rec 19/01/2024 - I’m writing because I have a concern about the sign that has been erected by the Car Park of the Clock Tower Restaurant in Cirencester Road Charlton Kings. It is meant to flash to warm motorists that they are exceeding the 30 limit but it isn’t flashing. To help you locate it the Post code for the Clock Tower is would be GL53 8DY. There is one on the same side of the road but nearer to the Double Tree Hotel that is flashing. Vehicles do come down Charlton Hill too fast and need to be reminded of the speed limit before entering the built up area.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amounts of water in road / pn footpath, 22nd January
item.description:
From junction of Tobyfield Road/ Close water is pouring back along Tobyfield. Children are being soaked by passing vehicles and footpaths to / from school are flooded.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tobyfield Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
